item.title: Sam Altman reacts to sexual abuse allegations by his sister. Mom and brother call claims ‘utterly untrue’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sam Altman Denies Sexual Abuse Allegations Made by Sister

Publication Date: Jan 08, 2025   |   Source: Hindustan Times

OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and his family have publicly denied allegations of sexual abuse made by his sister, Ann Altman, in a lawsuit filed against him. The family expressed concern for Ann's well-being in their statement.

  • Ann Altman alleges that Sam sexually abused her from 1997 to 2006.
  • The family attempts to support Ann financially and medically while asserting the claims are false.
  • The family's statement describes Ann's allegations as 'utterly untrue' and highlights their ongoing attempts to assist her.
  • Ann has reportedly made various allegations against family members over the years, complicating the situation.
“This situation causes immense pain to our entire family.”

The family is distressed by the legal actions and the claims made against them, asserting they wish to help but are met with resistance from Ann.

item.title: Stocks to watch, January 8: Berger Paints, Jindal Worldwide, Ola Electric, M&M, Tata Steel, CESC, and more - Upstox
item.description:

Date & Source: January 8, 2025

The domestic equity market is anticipated to open slightly lower on January 8, with global markets showing mixed trends.

  • Jindal Worldwide has announced a 4:1 bonus share issuance.
  • Berger Paints clarifies its position regarding the potential acquisition of Akzo Nobel's stake in India.
  • Dr Reddy's is selling its Louisiana subsidiary as part of a restructuring effort.
  • CESC has received approval for a new hybrid power project.
  • Tata Steel reports a 6% increase in Q3 crude steel production.
  • M&M announces pricing for its new electric SUVs.
  • Ola Electric received a warning from SEBI regarding information dissemination violations.
  • Sobha reports a 17.8% increase in sales value for Q3-FY25.
  • Rail Vikas Nigam Limited signs an MoU for infrastructure projects in the GCC.
  • Signatureglobal sees over double the bookings compared to last year.
  • Tata Technologies partners with Telechips for automotive innovations.
  • SBI appoints a new deputy managing director.
  • Puravankara appoints a new CFO with extensive experience.
  • NTPC establishes a subsidiary for nuclear energy projects.
  • Birlasoft's CEO resigns effective February 7.
  • Maruti Suzuki unveils its vision for electric mobility, ‘e For Me.’

(With inputs from Reuters)

item.title: Remember Zuckerberg admiring Anant Ambani’s watch? His ₹7.7 crore timepiece explodes internet - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mark Zuckerberg's ₹7.7 Crore Watch Sparks Social Media Frenzy

Date: Jan 08, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Mark Zuckerberg made headlines after he was seen wearing a luxurious watch valued at approximately ₹7.7 crore during a Facebook video announcement about a policy overhaul at Meta.

  • Zuckerberg's watch, a Greubel Forsey ‘Hand Made 1’, is extremely rare, with only two or three made each year.
  • His video announcement included the controversial decision to eliminate third-party fact-checkers from Meta's platforms.
  • The watch's cost sparked social media discussions, with many commenting on its value exceeding that of a typical house.
  • Notable reactions on social media included comments on the cultural disconnect of wearing such an expensive item while discussing community issues.
“Zuck was wearing a ~$1M watch in his community notes announcement video. Nothing says I understand the culture shift of the community more than a watch that costs more than most people's houses.”

This incident highlights the attention and discussions surrounding celebrity choices and their disconnect with everyday experiences.

item.title: Stocks to buy for short term: IREDA, Apollo Hospitals among 6 stocks that may rise 7-16% in 2-3 weeks, say analysts | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stocks to buy for short term: IREDA, Apollo Hospitals among 6 stocks that may rise 7-16% in 2-3 weeks, say analysts

Date: January 7

Source: Live Mint

Despite ongoing market volatility, analysts suggest investing in six particular stocks that may see gains in the coming weeks. These include IREDA and Apollo Hospitals, with expected upside potential ranging from 7% to 16%.

  • Indian stock market is experiencing mild gains in January.
  • Market uncertainty driven by foreign capital outflows and interest rate speculation.
  • Experts recommend six stocks to buy, including IREDA, Affle, and Apollo Hospitals.
  • Analysts forecast price growth ranging from 7% to 16% within 2-3 weeks.
"If the stock sustains above ₹7,550, it could move towards upside targets of ₹8,000-8,100." - Hardik Matalia

Investors are advised to be cautious and consider market conditions before making decisions.

item.title: BYD Sealion 7 to debut at Bharat Mobility Global Expo, launch in March 2025 - Business Standard
item.description:
BYD Sealion 7 to debut at Bharat Mobility Global Expo, launch in March 2025

Published on Jan 08 2025 | Source: Business Standard

The BYD Sealion 7 is all set to make its debut at the upcoming Bharat Mobility Global Expo in March 2025. This affordable coupe SUV, inspired by the BY Seal, features advanced technology and impressive design.

  • Unveiled last year in China, it serves as an alternative to the Tesla Model Y.
  • It includes a 360-degree camera system for enhanced safety.
  • The SUV offers two battery options with a maximum range of up to 502 km.
  • Expected to compete with EVs like Kia EV6 and Hyundai Ioniq 5 in India.
“The Sealion 7 is built on BYD’s e-Platform 3.0 Evo and features the brand’s Blade battery technology.”

This new model is anticipated to attract significant attention at the expo and in the Indian market upon its official launch.

item.title: SEBI warns Ola Electric over disclosures via social media ahead of exchange filings, seeks corrective action | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
SEBI Issues Warning to Ola Electric Over Premature Social Media Disclosures

Date: January 8, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Markets regulator SEBI has warned Ola Electric regarding violation of disclosure regulations due to a social media announcement made before official exchange filings.

  • SEBI warned Ola Electric for announcing corporate plans on social media before filing with stock exchanges.
  • Chairman Bhavish Aggarwal disclosed plans for expansion on social media hours before notifying stock exchanges.
  • The warning, issued on January 7, 2025, cites violations of SEBI regulations regarding equal access to information for investors.
  • Ola Electric has been advised to improve compliance standards and take corrective actions.
“By failing to first disseminate the information on the stock exchanges, you have failed to provide equal and timely access to information for all investors.” - SEBI Warning Letter

The warning emphasizes the need for compliance with regulations to avoid future enforcement actions from SEBI.

item.title: Stock Market Today: All You Need To Know Going Into Trade On Jan. 8 - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Today: All You Need To Know Going Into Trade On Jan. 8

Date: January 8, 2023 Source: NDTV Profit

  • Signature Global: The company reported a more than two-fold jump in sales bookings to Rs 2,770 crore on the back of better demand for its housing project in Gurugram.

  • Tata Steel: The company's production in India grew 6% year-on-year to 5.68 million tonnes due to the commissioning of a new blast furnace in Odisha.

  • Sobha: Reported a 29% year-on-year decline in total sales at Rs 1,388.6 crore despite improved price realization.

  • One Mobikwik Systems: Clarified a typographical error in financial results for the quarter ended Sept. 30, 2024.

  • Maruti Suzuki India: Set to unveil the E-Vitara at the Bharat Mobility Auto Show.

  • Exicom Tele-Systems: Signed a MoU to develop EV charging infrastructure.

  • Sapphire Foods: Received a GST demand order from the Bengaluru Tax Authority.

  • The Orissa Minerals Development Co: Suspended CFO Ramakanta Behera due to misconduct allegations.

  • State Bank of India: Appointed Baldev Prakash as deputy managing director.

  • Akzo Nobel, Berger Paints: Both denied any developments regarding stake acquisition rumors.

  • Blue Cloud Softech: Secured an order worth Rs 1.05 crore for AIoT products from a school.

  • Tata Technologies: Signed a MoU with Telechips for next-generation software solutions.

  • Rail Vikas Nigam: Exploring infrastructure opportunities in GCC countries.

  • Puravankara: Appointed a new CFO and approved an acquisition of shares.

  • Birlasoft: CEO of Americas Roopinder Singh resigned.

  • NTPC: Incorporated NTPC Parmanu Urja Nigam.

  • Waaree Renewable Technologies: CFO Dilip Panjwani has resigned.

  • WPIL: Acquired 100% stake in MISA Italy.

  • MedPlus Health Services: Received a suspension order for a store in Chhattisgarh.

  • Mahindra & Mahindra: Announced pricing for new electric SUVs aiming for strong sales.

  • Jindal Worldwide: Recommended issuing 4 bonus shares for each existing share.

  • Karnataka Bank: ICRA upgraded bond rating to 'A+'.

  • Mankind Pharma: Pledged its stake in Bharat Serums.

  • V-Mart Retail: Received a penalty order and plans to appeal.

  • CESC: Awarded a contract for a 150 MW Wind-Solar hybrid project.

  • Adani Power: Received a ‘CARE AA; Stable’ credit rating for proposed NCDs.

  • Vedanta: Received an order from CGST regarding an Oil & Gas block.

  • Popular Vehicles: Issued a tax order impacting their subsidiary significantly.

  • Castrol India, Gland Pharma, NBCC India, The Phoenix Mills, Solar Industries India, Torrent Power: Futures and options contracts will begin trading from Jan. 31.

Buy, Sell Or Hold: Indian Oil, Swiggy, Zomato, Ashok Leyland — Ask Profit

item.title: Buy or sell: Vaishali Parekh recommends three stocks to buy today — January 8 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Buy or sell: Vaishali Parekh recommends three stocks to buy today — January 8

Publication Date: January 8, 2023 | Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market showed positive movement on January 7, with the Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex closing higher amidst recovering investor sentiment following a recent virus outbreak. Analyst Vaishali Parekh has recommended three stocks for investors to consider.

Key Points:

  • The Nifty 50 index closed at 23,707.90 points, a rise of 0.39%.
  • The BSE Sensex rose by 0.30% to close at 78,199.11 points.
  • Vaishali Parekh predicts support for Nifty 50 at 23,550 points and resistance at 23,900 points.
  • Her stock recommendations include:
    • Larsen and Toubro: Buy at ₹3,645; Target ₹3,750; Stop Loss ₹3,580.
    • HDFC Life Insurance Company: Buy at ₹620; Target ₹650; Stop Loss ₹600.
    • IndusInd Bank: Buy at ₹980; Target ₹1,000; Stop Loss ₹965.
“Nifty has indicated a pullback after the huge erosion witnessed in the previous session,” said Parekh.

Conclusion: Parekh maintains a cautiously positive approach regarding the market and suggests potential for gains in the coming days as the market stabilizes.

item.title: Tata's Punch beats Swift to be top seller - The Times of India
item.description:
Tata's Punch surpasses Swift to be top seller

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

Tata Motors' Punch has been recognized as the best-selling car, overtaking the long-time leader, Swift.

  • The Tata Punch saw a significant rise in sales figures, which contributed to its new status.
  • Swift has been a dominant player in the market for several years but faced stiff competition this year.
  • Consumer preferences are shifting toward compact SUVs, aiding the Punch's success.
"The Punch's innovative design and features have resonated well with customers, making it a top choice in its segment." - Industry Expert

This shift in sales dynamics indicates changing consumer behavior towards compact SUVs over traditional hatchbacks.

item.title: Getty Images, Shutterstock gear up for AI challenge with $3.7 billion merger - Reuters
item.description:
Getty Images and Shutterstock Merge in $3.7 Billion Deal to Face AI Challenges

Date: January 7, 2023 | Source: Reuters

The merger between Getty Images and Shutterstock aims to create a powerhouse in the stock-image industry, valued at $3.7 billion, to adapt to challenges posed by artificial intelligence technology.

  • Getty Images is merging with rival Shutterstock to combat challenges from growing AI tools.
  • The deal is notable for its potential antitrust scrutiny from regulators.
  • Shutterstock shareholders will have several options in the merger, including cash or stock from Getty.
  • The combined company will lead with nearly $2 billion in annual revenues.
  • Getty’s CEO Craig Peters expresses confidence in securing antitrust approval.
  • The merger may yield up to $200 million in cost savings within three years.
"We don't control the timing of (the approval), but we have a high confidence. This has been a situation where customers have not had choice. They've always had choice," said Craig Peters.

This merger reflects an adaptive strategy in response to new technological threats in the visual content industry and highlights the evolving landscape with AI integration.

item.title: Apple sacks desi employees for 'misusing' donation plan - The Times of India
item.description:
Apple Fires Employees Over Misuse of Donation Program

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: Times of India

Apple has recently terminated employment for a number of its employees, citing misuse of a donation initiative intended to aid charitable causes. The move has provoked discussions regarding corporate ethics and employee behavior.

  • The termination was due to alleged misuse of a company donation program.
  • Apple emphasizes its commitment to charitable contributions and ethical behavior.
  • The incident is under scrutiny and raises questions about employee oversight and corporate responsibility.
"Our donation program is designed to support those in need, and misuse cannot be tolerated," a company spokesperson remarked.

This incident brings to light the importance of maintaining ethical standards in corporate contributions and the potential consequences for violations.

item.description:
Top Tech Trends for 2025

Publication Date: 2023, Source: Capgemini

This article discusses the critical technology trends expected to shape businesses in 2025, with a focus on AI and its applications across various industries.

  • The major impact of AI and Gen AI on business priorities and technology domains.
  • AI in cybersecurity ranks as the top most impactful trend for 2025.
  • AI-driven robotics will enhance productivity and safety in workplaces.
  • Nuclear energy is poised for a resurgence in response to the energy demands of AI technologies.
  • New-generation supply chains will leverage AI and other technologies to improve efficiency and sustainability.
“In 2025, we see AI and Gen AI having a major impact on companies’ priorities and also on many adjacent technology domains, such as robotics, supply chains, or tomorrow’s energy mix.”

Organizations are advised to leverage these trends to drive innovation and competitive advantage in the fast-evolving digital landscape.

item.title: Elon Musk's one-word take on alarming population decline in India and China - The Times of India
item.description:
Elon Musk's One-Word Reaction to Population Decline in India and China

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

An alarming decrease in population growth in India and China has drawn a succinct yet impactful response from Elon Musk.

  • Musk refers to the population decline as 'Alarming'.
  • Both countries are facing significant demographic challenges.
  • The impact could have far-reaching implications on the global economy and labor markets.
'This trend signals potential challenges for future economic growth.' - Elon Musk

As major players in the global economy, India and China's demographic shifts could reshape international markets and geopolitical dynamics.

item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 8: Tata Steel, RVNL, NTPC, Jindal Worldwide and more

Source: CNBC TV18

This article highlights key stocks to monitor for market trends today, featuring insights into Tata Steel, RVNL, NTPC, Jindal Worldwide, and others.

  • Tata Steel: Reported a 6.17% YoY increase in crude steel production in Q3FY25, reaching 5.68 million tonnes.
  • RVNL: Signed a MoU with GBHIC for civil infrastructure projects in the GCC region.

The stocks mentioned are essential for investors to keep an eye on today due to their significant developments, which may impact market performance.

item.title: ExplainSpeaking: What the latest GDP estimates tell about the state of India’s economy - The Indian Express
item.description:
ExplainSpeaking: What the latest GDP estimates tell about the state of India’s economy

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: Indian Express

The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) has released the First Advance Estimates (FAEs) of India’s GDP growth for the financial year 2024-25. These estimates suggest that India's nominal GDP is projected to reach Rs 324 lakh crores, growing 9.7% over the previous financial year.

  • The estimated nominal GDP for FY25 is $3.8 trillion at the exchange rate of 85 rupees to a dollar.
  • Real GDP is expected to be Rs 184.9 lakh crores, accounting for 57% of nominal GDP, indicating a growth deceleration.
  • Private consumption demand (PFCE) plays a crucial role, contributing almost 60% to GDP.
  • Government spending growth has been slow, averaging just 4.2% for the current year.
  • Investments have stalled since 2014, leading to reduced productive capacity growth.
"When one considers a slightly longer period, it becomes clear that India’s real economy is growing at less than 5% per annum."

The latest GDP figures serve as a reality check, revealing that while India's growth appears strong, much of this is boosted by a low base effect from the pandemic's economic contraction.

item.title: Billion-dollar potential: Haldiram's snack empire attracts global interest - Business Standard
item.description:
Billion-dollar potential: Haldiram's snack empire attracts global interest

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Reuters

The Agrwal family has initiated the process of selling a portion of Haldiram’s, a major player in the Indian savoury snack market, amidst growing interest from global private equity investors.

  • Haldiram's is negotiating to sell a fifth of the company at a valuation of $10 billion.
  • Previous discussions with firms like PepsiCo and Kellogg’s point to sustained investor interest.
  • Tata Consumer Products considered acquiring a 51% stake but hesitated due to the high valuation.
  • The company has a rich history dating back to 1937 in Bikaner, founded by Ganga Bishan Agrawal.
  • Court battles among family members for brand usage rights have been ongoing since 1991.
  • Market projections indicate the ethnic snacks sector could grow significantly from Rs 10,800 crore to Rs 19,500 crore by 2025-26.
“The Delhi and Kolkata families have been warring in court since 1991 to establish who has the actual right to use the Haldiram Bhujiawala and Haldiram’s brand in Delhi.”

The ongoing negotiations and market potential of Haldiram’s suggest a promising future for the popular snack brand as it navigates investor interest and legal challenges.

item.title: Gold rallies as concerns swell over US debt and upcoming bond auctions for this week - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold pops as concerns on rates and inflation in the US grow again after red hot ISM Services report

Date: January 7, 2025

Source: FXStreet

Gold price sees upward momentum as markets react to increasing concerns over US debt issuances and inflation following a strong ISM Services report.

  • US markets are preparing for substantial debt issuances, raising concerns about potential increases in interest rates.
  • The ISM Services sector report indicated inflationary pressures, which negatively affected expectations for interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.
  • Gold prices are stabilizing within a tactical formation, with upward and downward trends noted.
  • The US 10-year yield has reached an eight-month high due to inflation concerns.
  • Market speculations suggest that significant reactions to the new administration's tariff plans could influence gold prices.
"A stronger position for gold can be expected if patterns become clearer amid the ongoing economic tensions."

The article emphasizes the uncertainty in financial markets and the pivotal role of gold as a hedge against inflation in turbulent economic times.

item.title: Tata Steel Q3 update: India steel production rises 6% YoY to 5.68 million tonnes - The Economic Times
item.description:
Tata Steel Q3 update: India steel production rises 6% YoY to 5.68 million tonnes

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

Tata Steel India has reported a 6% year-on-year and an 8% sequential rise in crude steel production, reaching 5.68 million tonnes in Q3FY25, primarily driven by the expansion at Kalinganagar. Deliveries also hit a record high of 5.29 million tonnes.

  • Crude steel production increased due to the commissioning of a new blast furnace.
  • Deliveries marked the best ever Q3 sales performance, supported by both domestic and export markets.
  • Significant growth observed in various verticals, especially in branded products and e-commerce revenues.
  • Year-to-date production for 9MFY25 rose 5% to 16.2 million tonnes.
"Growth has been consistently aided by various strategic initiatives to enhance consumer experience," the company filing stated.

Overall, Tata Steel's strong performance in Q3 positions the company well for future growth amidst ongoing market demand.

item.title: Tata Steel Q3 Update: India production rises 6%, deliveries at record levels - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Tata Steel Q3 Update: India production rises 6%, deliveries at record levels

Date: January 7, 2024
Source: CNBC TV18

Tata Steel reported a significant increase in India's crude steel production for Q3FY25, with deliveries reaching record levels driven by strong domestic sales and exports.

  • India's crude steel production increased by 6.17% YoY to 5.68 MT for Q3FY25.
  • Deliveries in India reached a record 5.29 MT, up 8.4% YoY.
  • Tata Steel Netherlands saw 1.76 MT of liquid steel production, with 1.53 MT in deliveries, marking a 16% YoY growth.
  • Tata Steel UK faced production standstill at zero due to the blast furnace closures, with deliveries down 12.5% YoY.
“Tata Steel India deliveries were the ‘best ever 3Q’ sales at 5.29 million tons,” the company stated.

The significant growth in production and deliveries showcases Tata Steel's robust performance in India, establishing a strong position in both domestic and export markets.

item.title: Mahindra XEV 9e, BE 6 top variant prices announced; Check battery range, features, booking dates here - The Economic Times
item.description:
Mahindra XEV 9e, BE 6 top variant prices announced; Check battery range, features, booking dates here

Date: Tuesday
Source: Economic Times

Introduction

Mahindra and Mahindra has unveiled the prices for its electric SUVs, the Mahindra XEV 9e and BE 6, with various options and features designed for consumers eager for electric vehicle options.

Key Points

  • The Mahindra XEV 9e is priced at Rs 30.90 lakh for the top variant with a 79 kWh battery.
  • The BE 6 top-spec variant will retail at Rs 26.9 lakh.
  • Bookings for both SUVs will commence on February 14, with test drives starting January 14.
  • Deliveries of the XEV 9e will begin in March 2025, while the BE 6 deliveries are expected in early March.
  • The XEV 9e features two battery options (59kWh and 79kWh) and claims a range of 656km on the MIDC cycle.
  • Both models come equipped with advanced technology like a three-screen setup, augmented reality head-up displays, and a comprehensive ADAS suite.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“The 79kWh battery can be charged from 20 to 80 percent in 20 minutes using a 175kW DC fast charger.”

Conclusion

Mahindra’s new electric SUVs promise exciting features and competitive pricing, catering to the growing market for electric vehicles in India.

item.title: Unlocking value: These 6 mutual funds offered over 15% annual returns in last 10 years; should you invest? | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Unlocking Value: These 6 Mutual Funds Offered Over 15% Annual Returns in Last 10 Years; Should You Invest?

Publication Date: January 6, 2025   Source: Live Mint

Prior to investing in a mutual fund, investors should evaluate the performance of various schemes to understand historical trends and set realistic expectations for future performance.

What are Value Funds?

Value mutual funds follow a strategy focused on identifying undervalued stocks, investing at least 65% in stocks.

These Funds Gave Record Performance in 10 Years

Source: AMFI; Returns as of January 6, 2025

The JM Value Fund had the highest return at 17.40%, while the ICICI Prudential Value Discovery Fund is the largest in terms of assets managed.

This story is for informational purposes only. Please speak to a SEBI-registered investment advisor before making any investment-related decision.

item.title: NTPC forays into nuclear energy business by creating a new unit - CNBCTV18
item.description:
NTPC Launches New Nuclear Energy Subsidiary

Publication Date: January 7, 2025   Source: CNBC-TV18

State-run power giant NTPC Ltd has announced the establishment of its subsidiary, NTPC Parmanu Urja Nigam Ltd, to lead its nuclear energy initiatives.

  • NTPC Parmanu Urja Nigam Ltd (NPUNL) will focus on planning, developing, and operating nuclear energy projects.
  • The incorporation is part of the company's strategic push into nuclear energy after regulatory approvals.
  • NTPC has taken 100% ownership by subscribing to 50,000 equity shares at a nominal value of ₹10 each.
  • NTPC's net profit rose by 19.6% to ₹4,648 crore for the September quarter.
  • The company’s total installed capacity increased from 73,824 MW in September 2023 to 76,443 MW.
“NTPC PARMANU URJA NIGAM LIMITED, has been incorporated on 07.01.2025 as a wholly owned subsidiary of NTPC Limited for undertaking Nuclear Energy Business,” NTPC stated.

The establishment of NPUNL marks a significant step for NTPC as it diversifies into nuclear energy, a move that could reshape its future operations and enhance its energy portfolio.

item.title: Market Trading Guide: JK Cement, Pfizer among stock recommendations for Wednesday - The Economic Times
item.description:
Market Trading Guide: JK Cement, Pfizer among 4 stock recommendations for Wednesday

item.title: Quadrant Future Tek IPO: Issue subscribed 15.86 times on day 1; check details here | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Quadrant Future Tek IPO: Issue subscribed 15.86 times on day 1; check details here

Publication Date: January 7, 2025; Source: Live Mint

The initial public offering (IPO) of Quadrant Future Tek opened for subscription today, January 7, and saw exceptional interest, being subscribed over 15.86 times on the first day.

  • The IPO received bids for 9,18,47,850 shares against the offered 57,99,999 equity shares.
  • The price band for the shares is set between ₹275-290.
  • Retail and Non-Institutional portions were significantly oversubscribed at 54.84 times and 21.51 times, respectively.
  • Qualified Institutional Buyer portion received only 0.05 times subscription.
  • The company aims to raise ₹290 crore from this fresh issue.
  • Notable anchor investors included Citigroup, Capri Global, and various mutual funds.

Link Intime India Private Limited is the official registrar, while Sundae Capital Advisors acts as the lead manager for the public issue.

“Quadrant is a research-oriented company engaged in developing new generation Train Control and Signalling Systems for Indian Railways.”

This IPO marks a significant step for Quadrant Future Tek as it seeks to enhance operational capabilities and expand its market presence.

item.title: Temasek nears deal to buy 10% stake in Haldiram at $10 billion valuation - Business Standard
item.description:
Temasek Approaches Deal for 10% Stake in Haldiram Valued at $10 Billion

Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: [Insert Source]

After prolonged negotiations, Singapore government-owned investment firm Temasek is nearing a deal to acquire a 10 per cent stake in Haldiram Snacks Foods, with a valuation of $10 billion.

  • Temasek and the Agrawal family have signed a term sheet for the sale.
  • Other PE firms, including Bain Capital and Blackstone, also made offers.
  • Temasek plans to conduct due diligence and make a binding offer within a month.
  • Potential listing of Haldiram within a year to take advantage of the IPO boom.
  • Temasek's focus includes significant investments in healthcare and consumer products in India.
“Haldiram Snacks reported revenue of Rs 6,375 crore in FY23, up from Rs 5,195 crore in FY22.”

This transaction could reshape the investment landscape of India's consumer products sector, with Temasek looking to increase its footprint in the region.

item.title: Temasek nears deal to buy 10% stake in Haldiram's at $10 billion valuation - Business Standard
item.description:
Temasek nears deal to buy 10% stake in Haldiram's at $10 billion valuation

Date: Not specified, Source: Moneycontrol

Temasek is close to finalizing a deal to acquire a 10% stake in Haldiram Snacks Foods, valued at $10 billion, from the Agrawal family. The deal, if completed, could be one of the largest in India.

  • Temasek has signed a term sheet with the promoters of Haldiram Snacks Foods.
  • This opportunity comes after competing offers from private equity firms, including Blackstone and Bain Capital.
  • The firm is proceeding with due diligence and anticipates making a binding offer soon.
  • Haldiram Snacks reported an impressive revenue growth in FY23, achieving revenues of Rs 6,375 crore.
“Temasek plans to invest $10 billion in India by 2027.”

The potential acquisition is a strategic move by Temasek aimed at tapping into the growing consumer products sector in India.
